Hi channel!: I have some trouble setting up a Karmic laptop for a friend here. I have a router with broken IPv6 support, but after disabling IPv6 with Firefox I get online on web and can ping. But I still cant get any contact with apt-get, synaptic or updates. I tried to set both local and main servers in software sources.Any tips?
Can you go to, say, google.com?
Can not connect to archive.ubuntu.com:80 (1.0.0.0), time out
Sounds like a name resolution problem. What's in your /etc/resolv.conf?
Sounds right, but archive.ubuntu.com ought to come back as something other than 1.0.0.0...
yeah I also though that sounds a bit strange
It's a long shot, but it sounds like your upstream provider's DNS servers aren't resolving ubuntu.com names.
hmmm where do you mean to put that? Im quite a newbie.
Open a terminal and paste that.
It will resolve archive.ubuntu.com to an IP address by OpenDNS servers.
1 server found, got answer, and a list of 5 IPs
That's good. Use `nameserver 208.67.220.220' in your /etc/resolv.conf and try the update again.
Right. The update to /etc/network/interfaces will only take effect on reboot or a `/etc/init.d/networking restart'
Great! update manager got connected. Now, should I add another IP in there for the local norwegian package server, or should that one do?
that should do it for now, but you should follow mazda01's advice too.
